name: Criminal penalties
text: §342P-23  Criminal penalties.  Any person who knowingly violates this chapter or any condition in a permit or variance issued under this chapter, shall be fined not less than $5,000 nor more than $50,000 per day for each violation or imprisoned for not more than three years, or both.  If a conviction of a person is for a violation committed after a first conviction of the person under this section, the person shall be fined not more than $100,000 per day for each violation or imprisoned for not more than six years, or both. [L 1991, c 219, pt of §1; am L 1998, c 242, §11]
